content: If you haven't deleted profiles, the addressbook is somewhere. Name is abook.sqlite in case do a full search. Normally, the proflles used will be at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles. There may be multiple profiles there, and likely an abook.sqlite in each, so look for the one with latest update date. Also, look for history.sqlite for the collected address folder. Once you find it, you can copy into your active profile when thunderbird is not running, or use the tools>import>import a file option..
creator: davidsk

content:
Repair does nothing to the underlying store of message. It just builds a new index of messages in the store.

So either the file is corrupt, or that data is not there to index.

What the search is showing you is the portion of the message stored in the search index. It is only reinforcing that the messages are NOT there because it can not display them.

I suggest that you recheck that you account is configured as POP as if they are removed from an IMAP account then they would vanish as you suggest is happening.

Next is your Thunderbird 32 or 64bit? on what operating system.

Clearly you do not have Thunderbird on your iphone and that is the operating system reported from your initial post.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: The setting you want is under Reading & Display in Settings.

content:
Veramente, con POP3 l'impostazione standard di Thunderbird è di NON cancellare la posta dal server. È l'utente che deve manualmente modificare questa impostazione per cancellare la posta dal server (cosa generalmente sconsigliata).

Comunque, no non c'è alcun backup automatico. Tuttavia l'archivio di posta potrebbe ancora essere presente. Controlla nelle cartelle del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird se trovi file e/o cartelle che fanno riferimento al tuo account PEC e verifica che dimensione hanno i vari file.

Eventualmente si può poi provare a recuperare i messaggi.

Verifica inoltre se il tuo problema è riconducibile a questo bug -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79061.0
creator: @next

content:
La data del problema e' la stessa del bug.

Sono sparite letteralmente tutte le mail dell'unico account in POP3: le PEC su Aruba

Sono sparite anche sul sito mail di Aruba

Le dimensioni dell'archivio sono: 

   INBOX = 212.782 Kb    SENT = 65.835 Kb

content:
Sicuro che non ci sia altro? Mi pare strano. Avevi tutta la posta in una sola cartella (Posta in arrivo)?

Se vuoi puoi anche aggiungere delle schermate di cosa vedi nel profilo.

Comunque ripeto. Con POP3 la cancellazione dal server devi averla impostata tu. Di default Thunderbird lascia i messaggi sul server dopo averne scaricato una copia.

content:
Se l'account era POP3 devi aprire la cartella Mail che si vede nella seconda schermata.

Il fatto che ci sia anche una cartella ImapMail però indica che hai o hai avuto anche account IMAP.

È importante essere sicuri della tipologia di account, perché POP3 ed IMAP si comportano molto differentemente. Ad esempio la cancellazione simultanea delle mail anche dal server è tipica di IMAP.

content:
Ok, prova ad importare i file INBOX e SENT seguendo questa procedura

  • Installare l'estensione ImportExportTools NG -> https://addons.thunderbird.net/it/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/
  • Avviare Thunderbird, quindi sotto Cartelle locali, creare una nuova sottocartella in cui recuperare i messaggi
  • Su questa cartella fare click con il pulsante destro del mouse ed andare in ImportExportTools NG > Importa file mbox
  • Nella finestra di dialogo indicare la posizione del file mbox da importare
  • Eventualmente ripetere per gli altri file mbox

content:
If you are using 'View > Folders > Unified Then you cannot add a folder as a subfolder to a virtual unified 'Inbox' You need to click on the chevron > located to the left of the Unified 'Inbox' to expand and see the individual Inbox folders. Those individual account Inbox folders will have the account name not the name Inbox. Right click on the account name and select 'New Folder' That should allow you to add a new subfolder to that individual account Inbox.


IF you are using 'View' > 'Folders' > 'All' The mail accounts should be listed with their own set of folders. Right click on the 'Inbox' and select 'New Folder'

It would be useful to know what happens when you right click on Inbox. Is the 'New folder' option greyed out ? Or is the option available and you enter details, but 'Create folder' is not creating folder ?

Are you talking about an Imap mail account ? right click on imap mail account name folder and select 'Subscribe' click on 'Refresh' Do you see the new folder in the list ? If yes, select it and clickon 'Subscribe' clickon 'OK'

content:
Hai aggiunto alla rubrica il mittente / i mittenti associandoli però all'indirizzo dell'intermediario PEC e non al loro. Basta che cancelli questi due contatti:

La PEC nel sistema italiano è una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST è mediata dal una società abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici [1] (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremo quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST. Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato è che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di". Per risolvere il problema è necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica. 1. è una semplificazione funzionale al discorso

- the Reset button should appear. All passwords for accounts will be deleted

content:
It's an exact duplicate of an archived question that didn't have a solution.

"Error message on only one of my four gmail accounts.

"The STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. Mail server pop.gmail.com responded: Invalid credentials."

nothing has changed in my settings, yet this problem continues to present. need some help, please. "

The suggestion then was to set OAuth2 and that's what I did.
creator: asmusf

content:
asmusf said
The suggestion then was to set OAuth2 and that's what I did.

That has been the required authorization method for gmail for some time. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-gmail

As of May 30, 2022, Google no longer allows Less secure apps access for Gmail accounts, thus OAuth is required. If you are using Google supplied “app passwords“, Thunderbird version 91.8.0 and newer will make that conversion for you. Further, Gmail accounts do not work with Thunderbird 31 and older because they do not support Google's OAuth
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The latest TB 128 should support OS X 12.7.6, since it is newer than 10.15.

As for 'making a new tab', I'm not sure what you mean, as that usually refers to a browser. Do you mean you can't open messages or Settings in a tab? Does the same thing happen in safe/troubleshoot mode (hold Option when launching TB)?

There is a version 5.1.3 of the add-on for TB 128:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/shrunked-image-resizer/versions/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/installing-addon-thunderbird
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes,

Thanks so much for your patient reply (you didn't say what an idiot I was for asking such a question!). Boy am I embarrassed! I'm relatively new to tabs in Thunderbird as I only discovered the feature when I tried the calendar part of TB for the first time a couple of weeks ago trying to see if it's as good as the MS Outlook calendar which is the best I've tried (Apple's Calendar is pretty useless). Since then I forgot that a tab in TB only comes up when opening the calendar or when requesting that a message or folder etc. be opened in a new tab. Lesson learned!  :)

I'm equally (or even more) embarrassed about the Mac OS question. Somehow in my fevered brain I managed to interpret OS 10.15 as 15.10 (dyslexia?). My only excuse is that the new Mac OS Sequoia is 15.0, so when I saw "15"... Oh well, all sorted out now (except maybe my brain, but then I'm 78! ). :)

And by the way, for some reason or other (I won't try to understand) the Shrunked Image Resizer (SIR) seems to be working again. Thank goodness because as I said in my request for help, it really is a very useful — dare I say indispensable — Add-on, and I'm therefore inspired to ask why such a feature isn't already built into Thunderbird. Might you be able to answer that? If not, I would be grateful if you could suggest who I might contact about it. I'm worried about the SIR Add-on's future because apparently its author, Geoff Lankow (who I believe works or worked for Mozilla) decided sometime ago not to keep updating it, and I'm afraid that one day it won't work with future updates of TB.

Anyway, thanks so much for your quick answer to my ill-informed questions.

Cheers! Chris
creator: chrisnt1

content:
Any feature that's provided by a supported add-on is less likely to be built into the core app, as it requires devoting resources that might be better allocated to other concerns. In this case, your best bet is probably to contact the author himself for further information.

If it ever becomes incompatible with future versions, there are many free apps that perform image resizing, at least that is my understanding in the Windows world.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Do the developers interpret the word move as copy or what is happening? In some threads it appears that way. Yes, I CAN delete manually, and that appears to work, however it's a TERRIBLE solution. What, if something goes wrong with moving the maisl and I delete it without having actually created a copy in a local folder? What if the search function hasn't found all mails? etc.

Move should mean move, i.e. the email is in the new (local) location and removed (or moved to trash) in the previous location. That's the definition of the word...

Unfortunately I'm very much in a hurry to clear up space on Gmail and all I get is 10 copies of the same emails on my hard drive, with yet another copy on the server...
